COMMAND.name: show qos domain

PARAM.name: cos-tc-color
PARAM.help: COS map to tc and color

PARAM.name: exp-tc-color
PARAM.help: EXP map to tc and color

PARAM.name: dscp-tc-color
PARAM.help: DSCP map to tc and color

PARAM.name: tc-color-cos
PARAM.help: tc and color map to cos

PARAM.name: tc-color-exp
PARAM.help: tc and color map to exp

PARAM.name: tc-color-dscp
PARAM.help: Tc and color map to dscp

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to display the both ingress and egress information of QoS map-table.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: None
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to display the information of map-table in QoS domain 0. Switch# show qos domain 0 map-table all

COMMAND.name: show qos global
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to display the information of QoS global.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: None
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to display the information of qos global. Switch# show qos global

COMMAND.name: qos domain
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to creat a qos domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: None
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to creat qos domain 1. Switch(config)# qos domain 1

COMMAND.name: exit
COMMAND.help: Exit from qos global configuration mode

COMMAND.name: quit
COMMAND.help: Exit from qos global configuration mode

COMMAND.name: no
COMMAND.help: Negate a command or set its defaults

COMMAND.name: qos enable
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to enable qos.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: Qos disable
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to enable qos Switch(config-qos-global)# qos enable

COMMAND.name: no qos enable
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to disable qos.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: Qos disable
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to disable qos. Switch(config-qos-global)# no qos enable

COMMAND.name: qos ipg
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set qos rate-limiting if include ipg or not.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: Enable
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to enable qos ipg Switch(config-qos-global)# qos ipg enable

COMMAND.name: no
COMMAND.help: Negate a command or set its defaults

COMMAND.name: cos

PARAM.name: cos_value
PARAM.help: Select which COS will be specified map

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure qos mapping cos to tc and color in qos domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default mapping is: cos x to tc x and color green, such as cos 2 to tc 2 color green.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set cos 2 to tc 5 color yellow in qos domain 1. Switch(config)# qos domain 1 Switch(config-qos-domain-1)# cos 2 to tc 5 color yellow

COMMAND.name: no cos

PARAM.name: cos_value
PARAM.help: Select which COS will be specified map

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure default qos mapping cos to tc and color in qos domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default mapping is: cos x to tc x and color green. such as cos 2 to tc 2 color green.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set default cos to tc and color mapping in qos domain 1. Switch(config)# qos domain 1 Switch(config-qos-domain-1)#no cos 2 to tc

COMMAND.name: cos range
COMMAND.ACTION: if [ "${type}" == "phb" ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/cos2phb/${cos_value}/${map_value}/ else cdbctl update/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/cos2tc/${cos_value}/${map_value}/ if [ "$?" == "0" ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/cos2color/${cos_value}/${color_value}/ fi fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure qos mapping cos range to tc and color in qos domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default mapping is: cos x to tc x and color green. such as cos 2 to tc 2 color green.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set cos 2-5 to tc 2 and color yellow mapping in qos domain 1. Switch(config)# qos domain 1 Switch(config-qos-domain-1)#cos range 2-5 to tc 2 color yellow

COMMAND.name: no cos range
COMMAND.ACTION: if [ "${type}" == "phb" ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/cos2phb/${cos_value}// else cdbctl update/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/cos2tc/${cos_value}// if [ "$?" == "0" ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/cos2color/${cos_value}// fi fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure default qos mapping, cos range to tc and color in qos domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default mapping is: cos x to tc x and color green. such as cos 2 to tc 2 color green.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set default mapping about cos 2-5 to tc and color in qos domain 1. Switch(config)# qos domain 1 Switch(config-qos-domain-1)#no cos range 2-5 to tc

COMMAND.name: exp

PARAM.name: exp_value
PARAM.help: Select which EXP will be specified map

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure qos mapping exp to tc and color in qos domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default mapping is: exp x to tc x and color green. such as exp 2 to tc 2 color green.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set exp 2 to tc 5 color yellow in qos domain 1. Switch(config)# qos domain 1 Switch(config-qos-domain-1)#exp 2 to tc 5 color yellow

COMMAND.name: no exp

PARAM.name: exp_value
PARAM.help: Select which EXP will be specified map

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure default qos mapping exp to tc and color in qos domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default mapping is: exp x to tc x and color green. such as exp 2 to tc 2 color green.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set default exp to tc and color mapping in qos domain 1. Switch(config)# qos domain 1 Switch(config-qos-domain-1)#no exp 2 to tc

COMMAND.name: exp range
COMMAND.ACTION: if [ "${type}" == "phb" ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/exp2phb/${exp_value}/${map_value}/ else cdbctl update/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/exp2tc/${exp_value}/${map_value}/ if [ "$?" == "0" ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/exp2color/${exp_value}/${color_value}/ fi fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure qos mapping exp range to tc and color in qos domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default mapping is: exp x to tc x and color green. such as exp 2 to tc 2 color green.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set exp 2-5 to tc 2 and color yellow mapping in qos domain 1. Switch(config)# qos domain 1 Switch(config-qos-domain-1)#exp range 2-5 to tc 2 color yellow

COMMAND.name: no exp range
COMMAND.ACTION: if [ "${type}" == "phb" ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/exp2phb/${exp_value}// else cdbctl update/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/exp2tc/${exp_value}// if [ "$?" == "0" ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/exp2color/${exp_value}// fi fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure default qos mapping, exp range to tc and color in qos domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default mapping is: exp x to tc x and color green. such as exp 2 to tc 2 color green.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set default mapping about exp 2-5 to tc and color in qos domain 1. Switch(config)# qos domain 1 Switch(config-qos-domain-1)#no exp range 2-5 to tc

COMMAND.name: dscp

PARAM.name: dscp_value
PARAM.help: Select which DSCP will be specified map

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure qos mapping, dscp to tc and color in qos domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default mapping is: dscp x to tc x/8 and color green. such as dscp 12 to tc 1 color green.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set qos mapping about dscp 12 to tc 3 and color yellow in qos domain 1. Switch(config)# qos domain 1 Switch(config-qos-domain-1)#dscp 12 to tc 3 color yellow

COMMAND.name: no dscp

PARAM.name: dscp_value
PARAM.help: Select which DSCP will be specified map

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure default qos mapping, dscp to tc and color in qos domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default mapping is: dscp x to tc x/8 and color green. such as dscp 12 to tc 1 color green.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set default qos mapping about dscp 12 to tc and color in qos domain 1. Switch(config)# qos domain 1 Switch(config-qos-domain-1)#no dscp 12 to tc

COMMAND.name: dscp range
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure qos mapping, dscp range to tc and color in qos domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default mapping is: dscp x to tc x/8 and color green. such as cos 12 to tc 1 color green.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set qos mapping about dscp 0-20 to tc 3 and color yellow in qos domain 1. Switch(config)# qos domain 1 Switch(config-qos-domain-1)#dscp range 0-20 to tc 3 color yellow

COMMAND.name: no dscp range
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure default qos mapping, dscp range to tc and color in qos domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default mapping is : dscp x to tc x/8 and color green. such as cos 12 to tc 1 color green.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set default qos mapping about dscp 0-15 to tc and color in qos domain 1. Switch(config)# qos domain 1 Switch(config-qos-domain-1)#no dscp range 0-15 to tc

COMMAND.name: tc
COMMAND.ACTION: if [ "${type}" == "cos" ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/tc_color2cos/${tc_value}/${color_value}/${map_value}/ elif [ "${type}" == "exp" ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/tc_color2exp/${tc_value}/${color_value}/${map_value}/ elif [ "${type}" == "dscp" ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/tc_color2dscp/${tc_value}/${color_value}/${map_value}/ else cdbctl update/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/pri_color2exp/${pri_value}/${color_value}/${map_value}/ fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure qos mapping, tc and color to cos ,exp or dscp in qos domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default mapping is: tc x and color all to cos x, exp x and dscp x*8. such as tc 3 and color green to cos 3, exp 3, dscp 24.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set qos mapping about tc 3 and color yellow to cos 6 in qos domain 1. Switch(config)# qos domain 1 Switch(config-qos-domain-1)#tc 3 color yellow to cos 6

COMMAND.name: no tc
COMMAND.ACTION: if [ "${type}" == "cos" ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/tc_color2cos/${tc_value}/${color_value}// elif [ "${type}" == "exp" ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/tc_color2exp/${tc_value}/${color_value}// elif [ "${type}" == "dscp" ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/tc_color2dscp/${tc_value}/${color_value}// else cdbctl update/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/pri_color2exp/${pri_value}/${color_value}// fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure default qos mapping, tc and color to cos, exp or dscp in qos domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default mapping is: tc x and color all to cos x, exp x and dscp x*8. such as tc 3 and color green to cos 3, exp 3, dscp 24.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set default qos mapping about tc 3 and color yellow to cos in qos domain 1. Switch(config)# qos domain 1 Switch(config-qos-domain-1)#no tc 3 color yellow to cos

COMMAND.name: tc range
COMMAND.ACTION: if [ "${type}" == "cos" ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/tc_color2cos/${tc_value}/${color_value}/${map_value}/ elif [ "${type}" == "exp" ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/tc_color2exp/${tc_value}/${color_value}/${map_value}/ elif [ "${type}" == "dscp" ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/tc_color2dscp/${tc_value}/${color_value}/${map_value}/ else cdbctl update/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/pri_color2exp/${pri_value}/${color_value}/${map_value}/ fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure qos mapping, tc range and color to cos, exp or dscp in qos domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default mapping is: tc x and color all to cos x, exp x and dscp x*8. such as tc 3 and color green to cos 3, exp 3, dscp 24.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set qos mapping about tc range 2-4 and color yellow to cos 6 in qos domain 1. Switch(config)# qos domain 1 Switch(config-qos-domain-1)#tc range 2-4 color yellow to cos 6

COMMAND.name: no tc range
COMMAND.ACTION: if [ "${type}" == "cos" ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/tc_color2cos/${tc_value}/${color_value}// elif [ "${type}" == "exp" ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/tc_color2exp/${tc_value}/${color_value}// elif [ "${type}" == "dscp" ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/tc_color2dscp/${tc_value}/${color_value}// else cdbctl update/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/pri_color2exp/${pri_value}/${color_value}// fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure default qos mapping, tc range and color to cos, exp or dscp in qos domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default mapping is : tc x and color all to cos x, exp x and dscp x*8. such as tc 3 and color green to cos 3, exp 3, dscp 24.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set default qos mapping about tc range 2-4 and color yellow to cos in qos domain 1. Switch(config)# qos domain 1 Switch(config-qos-domain-1)#no tc range 2-4 color yellow to cos

COMMAND.name: qos domain
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure QoS domain for an interface.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to change the QoS domain of interface.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default QoS domain for each interface is 0.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure QoS domain for an interface. Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# qos domain 5

COMMAND.name: no qos domain
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To return to the default QoS domain of interface value, use this command.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to change the QoS domain of interface.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default QoS domain for each interface is 0.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to cancel this setting. Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no qos domain

COMMAND.name: replace dscp
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure replace dscp for an interface.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to configre replace dscp of interface.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default action of replace dscp for each interface is disable.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure replace dscp for an interface. Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# replace dscp

COMMAND.name: no replace dscp
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To return to the default action of replace dscp, use this command.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to change the replace dscp action of interface.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default action of replace dscp for each interface is disable.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to cancel this setting. Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no replace dscp

COMMAND.name: replace cos
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure replace cos for an interface.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to configre replace cos of interface.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default action of replace cos for each interface is disable.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure replace cos for an interface. Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# replace cos

COMMAND.name: no replace cos
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To return to the default action of replace cos, use this command.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to change the replace cos action of interface.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default action of replace cos for each interface is disable.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to cancel this setting. Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no replace cos

COMMAND.name: trust

PARAM.name: dscp-exp
PARAM.help: Differentiated service code point and mpls exp

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure trust type for an interface, such as trust cos, trust dscp-exp, trust port.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default trust state of an interface is trust cos.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure trust dscp-exp for an interface. Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# trust dscp-exp

COMMAND.name: no trust
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set default trust state for an interface.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default trust state of an interface is trust cos.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set default trust state for an interface. Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no trust

COMMAND.name: set cos
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set interface cos.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default cos of an interface is 0.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set interface eth-0-1 cis 5. Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# set cos 5

COMMAND.name: no set cos
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set default cos for an interface.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default cos of an interface is 0.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set interface eth-0-1 default cos. Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no set cos
